intro: Hemitelia brunoniana var. scottii, commonly known as the Scott's hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and leathery, elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a unique and sought-after specimen in horticultural collections.
